title.narrative: Lifesaving and Protection support to drought and conflict affected vulnerable men, women, girls and boys in Sanaag region of Somaliland.

description.narrative:
For this integrated response, Candlelight for Environment Education and Health (Candlelight) is collaborating with ACTED where Candlelight will facilitate the provision of protection services and ACTED will implement CCCM, Shelter/NFI and WASH activities. ACTED and Candlelight will provide support in the same IDP sites thereby complementing and enhancing overall improvement of IDP conditions in the target areas.
The proposed intervention, built on the Do No Harm principles acknowledges the consequences of recurrent droughts, conflicts and the resultant protection issues to the vulnerable women, girls, boys and men. The project is targeting the most affected IDP settlements/ villages and where not many local aid agencies are active in. The project is part of Candlelight’s overall emergency response plan towards drought affected communities in Somaliland.
Considering the pressing protection needs described, the proposed project will provide interventions to expand lifesaving GBV and other forms of violence, protection and child protection services to vulnerable IDP populations in six settlements in Sanaag region. Candlelight will conduct GBV and protection assessment in the 3 target districts to identify and map out hot spots that need emergency response. Thereafter humanitarian staff, Community Based Protection Facilitators and other stakeholders will be trained and deployed to provide the necessary support to the survivors of violence. The project will also support to strengthen local and national level coordination on GBV and improve the functioning of referral pathways to ensure women and girls have timely and confidential access to life saving services. Candlelight will identify and work with existing protection service providers. Community outreaches will be conducted targeting community members to raise awareness on services and facilitate confidential referrals to GBV response services.
The project will establish safe and child friendly spaces in each of the district. Broadly, the purpose of these spaces is to support the resilience and well‐being of children and young people through community organized, structured activities conducted in a safe, child friendly, and stimulating environment. Psycho-social support and other child friendly activities will be offered to children and youth who attend the child friendly spaces. This will be done by trained attendants. It’s estimated that each space will host atleast 150 children through the project period. Field Coordinators, Community Protection Facilitators and other leaders will identify separated and unaccompanied children. These will be reunited with their parents/ care takers. Reunification exercise will also include some material support to the households.
In terms of coverage, this project will be implemented over a period of 12 months in six settlements of Badhan, Gumar, Rabcada, Xingalool, Balibusle and Dhahar targeting approximately 13380 ( 6968 female) direct beneficiaries.
